I honestly think everyone involved has the wrong idea about Phobias 
ship, I sent the details to Yanosh to help clear up a few things.

Oh well hopefully we'll come to some agreement tomorrow, If not then 
I can always arrange a collision course with the Ark and end this 
game real quick. (Relax, I'm kidding) respond with ya later

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "THECODE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Hey, that's not a bad idea! Only being able to fly or use the 
CR
> Chambers one at a time! That's not bad!...
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <cyberwolf4@p...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> Sent: Saturday, September 09, 2000 1:27 AM
> Subject: Is this better?
> 
> 
> >
> > OK, simple sollution,
> >
> > Phobia hated making the decisions of leadership. "Get us out of 
here
> > now." He yelled knowing that the tone of his voice had nothing to 
do
> > with the reaction time of his ship.
> >
> > "Insuficient thrust by .75 percent" the ship replied. The ship was
> > carrying far more passengers than it was designed to, There were 5
> > seats occupied, three crew quarters, and the cargo bay holding the
> > escaping predacons.
> >
> > Now came the decision he'd been dreading. "Relay power from the CR
> > chamber to the engines." Phobia just hoped that nobody was damaged
> > critically.
> >
> > The ship flew skyward as the Predacon cave exploded. Sparks 
erupted
> > from systems around the bridge. The takeoff saved them from 
further
> > harm. The landing however would be a little tricky.
> >
> >
> >
> > There happy now?
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > > I think my last post may have been unclear. I meant that the 
ship
> > can fly, or
> > > have a CR, but not both.
> >
> >
> >
> >
